block.p: An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items may be submitted by mail, at least three weeks in advance, to Westchester Cultural Calendar, North Salem, N.Y. 10560.
THEATER

CROTON FALLS -- ''Summer Shorts,'' festival of short plays featuring ''The Lost Mertz'' by Amy Beth Arkawy; ''The Drive Home'' by Mark Bellusci; ''Once Around the Block'' by Holly Egloff and ''The White Inferno'' by Catherine Gonick. Today at 4 p.m. Tickets: $10. Staged reading of ''The Unexpected Man'' by Yasmina Reza. Friday at 8 p.m. Staged reading of ''The Beauty Queen of Leenane'' by Martin McDonough. Next Saturday at 8 p.m. Through July. Donation: $12 each. The Schoolhouse, Owens Road. (914) 277-8477.

THEATER

CROTON FALLS -- ''Summer Shorts,'' festival of short plays featuring ''The Lost Mertz'' by Amy Beth Arkawy; ''The Drive Home'' by Mark Bellusci; ''Once Around the Block'' by Holly Egloff and ''The White Inferno'' by Catherine Gonick. Today at 4 p.m. Tickets: $10. Staged reading of ''The Unexpected Man'' by Yasmina Reza. Friday at 8 p.m. Staged reading of ''The Beauty Queen of Leenane'' by Martin McDonough. Next Saturday at 8 p.m. Through July. Donation: $12 each. The Schoolhouse, Owens Road. (914) 277-8477.

GARRISON -- Hudson Valley Shakespeare Festival performs ''Measure for Measure.'' Tonight at 6, Wednesday and Thursday at 7 p.m. and next Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Through July 30. Tickets: $19 to $30, with discounts (except Saturday evenings) for students, people 65 and older and children. Picnicking encouraged one and a half hours before shows. Picnic dinners available by reservation, two days in advance. Cost: $16 and $18. Tented lawn of Boscobel Restoration, 1601 Route 9D. (845) 265-9575.

MAMARONECK -- The comedy ''The Mysterious Mr. Love.'' Thursday through Friday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 2 and 7 p.m. Through July 23. Tickets: $20 and $24; members, $15. Emelin Theater, Library Lane. (914) 698-0098.

MONTROSE -- ''Come Blow Your Horn,'' comedy by Neil Simon. Presented by Hand to Mouth Players. Today at 2 p.m., next Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 2 p.m. Tickets: $10; people 62 and older and children, $8. (914) 734-4336. Open auditions for Hand to Mouth Players' playwright and director workshop, featuring five short original plays. Tonight at 7 and Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. (Performances Aug. 25 through 27.) (914) 734-8486. Theater of building 2, Veterans Affairs Hospital, Route 9A.

NEW ROCHELLE -- ''Shakespeare on the Sound,'' Fleetwood Stage presents ''Comedy of Errors.'' Today and Thursday through next Sunday at 8 p.m. Through July 30. Free admission. Bring ground cover. Picnicking encouraged, with sale of refreshments. Waterfront lawn of Wildcliff Stage, 44 Wildcliff Drive. (914) 654-8533.
NYACK -- The musical ''Mame,'' starring Carol Lawrence. Today at 2 and 7 p.m. Tickets: $25 to $32.50. Helen Hayes Performing Arts Center, 117 Main Street. (845) 358-6333.

YORKTOWN HEIGHTS -- The musical ''1776'' by Yorktown Stage. Friday and next Saturday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 3 p.m. Through July 23. Tickets: $22; students, $18; children, $12. Yorktown Community Cultural Center, Veterans Road. (914) 962-0606.
MUSIC AND DANCE

CHAPPAQUA -- Joachim Piano and Violin Duo perform works by Ravel, Beethoven, Gershwin and Leonard Bernstein. Presented in private home by Amadeus Conservatory of Music. Next Sunday at 4 p.m. Tickets: $25; $20 if bought by Tuesday. (914) 238-0388.

COLD SPRING -- Doansburg Chamber Ensemble performs selections by Hummel, Kuhlau, Carl Stamitz and world premiere of Antony Paasch's ''Scherzo for Flute, Cello and Piano.'' Next Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $9; students and people 62 and older, $8. St. Mary's in the Highland's Episcopal Church. (845) 228-4167.

DOBBS FERRY -- David (Fathead) Newman Quartet. Part of Dobbs Ferry summer music series. Wednesday from 6:30 to 8 p.m. Free. Waterfront Park. (Rain location, Embassy Community Center, 60 Palisade Street.) (914) 631-1000.
EASTCHESTER -- Westchester Band; Dr. Joseph Albright, conductor. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Free. Lawn of Eastchester Town Hall. (914) 723-7171.

KATONAH -- Caramoor International Music Festival continues with scenes from rarely heard bel canto operas, in semistaged concert form. Music of Bellini, Paisiello, Rossini, Donizetti and Verdi. Thursday at 4:30 p.m. Tickets: $15. New music ensemble Eighth Blackbird, performing classical songs from George Crumb to Carlos Sanchez-Gutierrez. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25. ''Summer Symphony,'' Helene Grimaud, pianist, with Orchestra of St. Luke's; Donald Runnicles, conductor. Works by Stravinsky, Schumann and Beethoven. Next Saturday at 8:30 p.m. Tickets: $15 to $55. ''Millennium Marathon,'' Shanghai Quartet and Bachmann-Klibonoff-Fridman Trio perform works by Schumann and Brahms. Next Sunday at 4 p.m., with preconcert conversation at 3. Tickets: $25 and $35. Caramoor, Girdle Ridge Road. (914) 232-1252.

MAMARONECK -- Good and Plentie Band, playing favorites from the 1950's to the present. Sponsored by Village of Mamaroneck Council of the Arts. Tonight at 7. (Rain date, tomorrow.) Free. Harbor Island Park. (914) 777-7722.

MAHOPAC -- ''Jazz: The American Story,'' concert by Michelle LeBlanc Quintet. Presented by Putnam Valley Historical Society and Carmel Recreation. Wednesday from 7:30 to 9:30 p.m. (Rain date, Thursday.) Free. Sycamore Park, Long Pond Road. (845) 528-5648.

NEW ROCHELLE -- Israeli folk dancing for all levels. First of three sessions. Tomorrow from 8:15 to 10 p.m. Cost: $8 each; $6 for members. Jewish Community Center, 999 Wilmot Road. (914) 472-3300, ext. 351.

NORTH SALEM -- ''City That Drinks the Mountain Sky,'' family concert about water. Presented with poetry and puppetry by Arm of the Sea. Friday at 7 p.m. Cost: $15 a car; North Salem residents, free. Bring ground cover. Japanese Stroll Garden of Hammond Museum, top of Deveau Road, off June Road. (914) 669-5033.
PAWLING -- Patty Larkin, with guest artist, Bob Malone. Friday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $20; members, $17.50. Towne Crier Cafe, 130 Route 22. (845) 855-1300.

PURCHASE -- Afro-Cuban Salsa music by the group Manana. Thursday at 6:30 to 8 p.m., with dance lessons at 6. Free. Picnicking encouraged with sale of refreshments. In front of Neuberger Museum of Art, Purchase College. (Rain location, Neuberger Museum.) (914) 251-6100.

RIVERDALE -- Nai-Ni Chen Dance Company, accompanied by Korean percussion ensemble. Performing site-specific work in response to the beauty of Wave Hill. Wednesday at 6:30 p.m. Free with grounds admission: $4; students and people 62 and older, $2; children 5 and younger, free. Wave Hill, 675 West 249th Street and Independence Avenue. (718) 549-3200.
SCARSDALE -- Westchester Band concert; Dr. Joseph Albright, conductor. Thursday at 8 p.m. Free. Chase Park. (Rain location, Hoff-Barthelson Music School.) (914) 723-7171.

SOMERS -- Outdoor jazz concerts. Fridays at noon to 2 p.m. Through July 28. Free. Picnicking encouraged. (914) 232-9511. ''Latin Music Festival,'' featuring Andean folk music by Chu'uwa Yacu; Samba by Pe-De-Boi and Salsa by Willie Villegas y Entre Amigos. Next Saturday from 5 to 8 p.m., with grounds open for picnicking at 4:30. Tickets: $10; children 17 and younger, $3. (Note: parking is one-third mile from concert area.) (914) 693-5595. Lasdon Park, Arboretum and Veterans Memorial, Route 35.
TARRYTOWN -- Music and dance of South America by Ballet Folklorico de Chile. Today at 4 p.m. Tickets: $20. Music Hall, 13 Main Street. (914) 332-9372.

WHITE PLAINS -- Marches, show tones, classical and pop music by White Plains Recreation Pops Band; Alfred A. Renino, director. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Free. Bring ground cover. (Rain location, Highlands Middle School.) (914) 422-1336.
YONKERS -- Larry Chance and the Earls. Presented by North Bronx-Westchester Neighborhood Restoration Association. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Coyne Park, McLean Avenue. (718) 823-7706.

YONKERS -- Dance or listen to the music of big band sounds by Gerard Carelli Orchestra. Friday 8 p.m. Admission: $10, with viewing of museum's exhibitions and Glenview Mansion from 5 to 8 p.m. and planetarium show at 7; museum members, $5; children, free. Barbecue buffet and other refreshments available, beginning at 6 p.m. Rain or shine. Courtyard of Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Avenue. (914) 963-4550.
ART
COLD SPRING -- Photographs of historic houses in Putnam County. Through August. Putnam County Historical Society and Foundry School Museum, 63 Chestnut Street. (845) 265-4010.

ELMSFORD -- ''A Path in the Woods and Other Diversions,'' acrylic paintings by Leigh Trifari. Reception Friday from 7 to 8:30 p.m. Through July. Greenburgh Town Hall, Tarrytown Road and Hartsdale Avenue. (914) 422-1038.

LARCHMONT -- Impressionistic images by Joan Tait and Abstract and Expressionist paintings by Mara Attina. Through Aug. 29. Reception next Saturday from 3 to 4:30 p.m. Larchmont Public Library, 121 Larchmont Avenue. (914) 834-2281.
MOUNT KISCO -- ''Gone Fishin','' juried show. Through July 30. Northern Westchester Center for the Arts, 272 North Bedford Road. (914) 241-6922.

NORTH SALEM -- Exhibition of 100 rare vintage advertising posters and ephemera from the 1890's through the Art Deco period. Also sculpture by Shamus Langlois and works by David Bumbeck. Through next Sunday. Charles Michael Gallery, junction of Routes 116 and 121, Keeler Lane. (914) 669-4600.

PURCHASE -- PepsiCo sculpture gardens, featuring works by Max Ernst, Henry Moore, Alexander Calder, set among flowers, fountains and landscaped lawns and wooded areas. Daily from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Free. Anderson Hill Road. (914) 253-2000.

PURCHASE -- ''Recent Acquisitions: Selections From Lawrence Gussman Collection of African Art,'' ''Whitfield Lovell: Portrayals,'' ''Welded! Sculpture of the 20th Century,'' ''Selections From the Roy R. Neuberger Collection,'' ''Object and Intellect: African Art From the Permanent Collection'' and ''Ancient Civilizations: Roy R. Neuberger Collection.'' Tuesdays through Fridays from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. and Saturdays and Sundays from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Admission: $4; students and people 62 and older, $2; children, free. Neuberger Museum of Art, Purchase College. (914) 251-6100.

PURCHASE -- ''The Group: Women Artists of a New Century,'' paper constructions, collage, sculpture, portraits and prints by Janet Bohman, Marilyn Miller, Barbara K. Schwartz, Susan Sills and Virginia Evans Smit. Through July 30. Library of Manhattanville College. (914) 323-5277.
RYE -- ''Canvases of Rock, Earth, Wood and Water,'' nature photographs by Ida Luftig. Through July. Rye Nature Center, 873 Boston Post Road. (914) 967-5150.
SHRUB OAK -- Exhibition by children's bo illustrators, Rose Mary Berlin, Jo-Ellen Bosson and Nancy Lane. Through July 27. John C. Hart Memorial Library, 1130 Main Street. (914) 245-5262.

WHITE PLAINS -- ''Westchester in the Movies,'' featuring photographs and posters highlighting movies produced in Westchester. Including photographs of the 1918's ''Tarzan'' film, starring Elmo Lincoln, and more recent films, including ''Age of Innocence'' and ''Ragtime.'' Through Labor Day. Museum gallery of White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-1480.

YONKERS -- ''A Midsummer Night's Dream,'' exhibition (at two locations) of works that depict landscapes or the use of natural materials. By Sheila Benedis, Eleanor Goldstein and Catherine L. Wells, at Will Library, 1500 Central Park Avenue. By Vivian Bergenthal, Gregory Paul Henne, Cheryl Jelonek Kawalerski and Terry Kessler Schwarz at Getty Square Branch of Yonkers Public Library. Through August. (914) 337-1500.
LECTURES

MAMARONECK -- New tax strategies for parents and grandparents by Julian Block. Sponsored by Larchmont-Mamaroneck Center for Continuing Education. Friday at 8:30 a.m.. $25. Registration. Mamaroneck High School. (914) 698-3255.

SLEEPY HOLLOW -- Readings by novelists Jo Ann Beard and Scott Spencer. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Admission: $5, including refreshments; members, $3. Hudson Valley Writers Center, 300 Riverside Drive. (914) 332-5953.

YONKERS -- Educational standards in a democratic society are discussed by Dr. Harriet K. Cuffaro, specialist of early childhood progressive education. Tomorrow at 11:30 a.m. Free. Sarah Lawrence College. (914) 395-2412.
FILMS
PEEKSKILL -- ''High Fidelity.'' Thursday through next Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $9. Paramount Center, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.

SUFFERN -- ''Burn Hollywood Burn.'' Part of independent film series sponsored by Finkelstein Memorial Library. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Donation: $3; students and people 60 and older, $1. Rockland Community College. (845) 352-5700, ext. 243.
WHITE PLAINS -- ''Nights of Cabiria,'' Italian film with English subtitles. Tomorrow at 2 and 7 p.m. Free. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-1480.
CHILDREN
BEDFORD -- Pond exploration for all ages, with small nets available for children. Today at 2 p.m. Free. Westmoreland Sanctuary, 260 Chestnut Ridge Road. (914) 666-8448.

CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- Hudson River songs and tales performed by Kidfriendly Music. For second graders and older children. Next Saturday at 11 a.m. Free. Croton Free Library, 171 Cleveland Drive. (914) 271-6612.

GREENBURGH -- ''Please Bug Me!'' Program for all ages highlighting the many unusual and harmless insects found in the county. Today at 2 p.m. Cost: $2; members, free. Nature explorers class for first and second graders. Wednesday at 3:45 to 4:45 p.m. Through July 26. Junior naturalist class for third through sixth graders. Thursday at 3:45 to 4:45 p.m. Through July 27. Cost: $24 each; members, $16. Registration. Greenburgh Nature Center, Dromore Road. (914) 723-3470.
HARRISON -- Children's entertainer Graham Clarke. Program for children 8 and younger. Thursday at 2 p.m. Free. West Harrison Library. (914) 948-2092.
OSSINING -- Corner Store Dance Company. Tuesday at 3 p.m. Free. Ossining Public Library, 53 Croton Avenue. (914) 941-2416.

OSSINING -- Family night prowl program. Discover the importance of the senses (hearing, touching and smelling) while hiking. Friday from 8 to 9:30 p.m. Cost: $8; members, $6. Registration. Meet at nature center of Teatown Lake Reservation, 1600 Spring Valley Road. (914) 762-2912.

PLEASANTVILLE -- Nature discoveries camp for children 5 through 7. Children learn about animals, take nature walks, play games and make crafts. July 17 through July 21 at 9 a.m. to noon. Cost: $135; members, $130. Registration. Pace University Environmental Center, 861 Bedford Road. (914) 773-3789.
RYE -- Fireworks display. Wednesdays and Fridays at 9:15 p.m. Parking: $4. Playland Park. (914) 925-2700.
SLEEPY HOLLOW -- Guided tour of Tarrytown Lighthouse. Next Saturday at 10 a.m. Free. Meet in parking lot of Kingsland Point Park. (914) 242-7275.

SOUTH SALEM -- ''Shakespeare in the Park,'' family show performed by Trinity Repertory Company. Sponsored by Northern Westchester Center for the Arts and Lewisboro Department of Parks and Recreation. Today at 6 p.m. Free. (Picnicking, air castle and pony rides from 5 to 6 p.m. pony rides, $3; air castle, $2.) Onatru Farm, 99 Elmwood Road. (Rain date, tomorrow at John Jay High School.) (914) 232-6166.

WHITE PLAINS -- Children 6 and older listen to ''The Robobots,'' then create their own robot. Family night with silly songs and stories. For children 3 and older. Wednesday at 7 p.m. Music and movement program for children 3 and older. Thursday at 11 a.m. All free. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-1476.

YONKERS -- Tours of the Half Moon, a replica of Henry Hudson's 1609 vessel. Today from noon to 5 p.m. Cost: $5. (Tickets sold at museum.) J. F. K. Marina, just below the museum. ''Guided by the Sky,'' new planetarium show for children 8 and older and adults. Learn how navigators, mapmakers and timekeepers used the sky to gain knowledge. Today and Saturday and next Sunday at 3:30 p.m. Admission: $4; people 62 and older and children, $3. Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Avenue. (914) 963-4550. (914) 963-2139 for 24-hour recorded planetarium message.
POTPOURRI
CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- French wine- tasting program with Vincent DePrez. Friday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Reservations. Croton Free Library, 171 Cleveland Drive. 271-6612.

GARRISON -- One-and-a-half hour tours of Manitoga's house and grounds. Continuing next Saturday from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. Tickets: $15; members, $13.50. Reservations. Route 9D, two miles south of Route 403. (845) 424-3812.

MOUNT VERNON -- Demonstration of ''Anne Hutchinson: An Uncommon Woman,'' rebel against Puritan orthodoxy. (She and her family were later massacred by Indians.) Wednesday from 12:15 to 1 p.m. Free. St. Paul's Church National Historic Site, 897 South Columbus Avenue. (914) 667-4116.

NEW ROCHELLE -- Big Apple Classic. Pro-Am. Tomorrow at 8 a.m., followed by qualifying round at 1 p.m. Practice rounds of L.P.G.A. Tuesday at 7:30 a.m. Classic Pro-Am. Begins Wednesday at 8 a.m. Admission: $10 daily. First through third rounds. Thursday through next Saturday at 8 a.m. Finals. Next Sunday at 8 a.m. Admission: $15 daily. Wykagyl Country Club. (800) 444-5742.

NORTH SALEM -- Asian arts festival with Tibetan ritual dance, Chinese lion dance, Korean dances and Japanese Taiko drums. Also demonstrations of Asian painting, wood carving and carpet weaving, along with children's workshops. Sale of crafts and refreshments. Next Sunday from 1 to 6 p.m. Admission: $10; members, $8; children, free. Hammond Museum and Japanese Stroll Garden, top of Deveau Road. (914) 669-5033.

RYE -- House tours of Jay Heritage Center, followed by lemonade on the veranda. Sundays, including today at 2:30 p.m. Through August. Admission: $5; children, free. 210 Boston Post Road. (914) 698-9275.

WESTCHESTER -- Tour of seven private gardens in Hartsdale, Edgemont and Crestwood section of Yonkers. Presented by Girl Scouts of Westchester/Putnam. Next Saturday from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Tickets: $30. (914) 747-3080, ext. 219.
